name: linsys-v

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description: LINSYS_V: Verified Solution of Linear Systems

dependencies.name: blas
dependencies.description:
AMD Optimized BLIS. BLIS is a portable software framework for
instantiating high-performance BLAS-like dense linear algebra libraries.
The framework was designed to isolate essential kernels of computation
that, when optimized, immediately enable optimized implementations of
most of its commonly used and computationally intensive operations.
LICENSING INFORMATION: By downloading, installing and using this
software, you agree to the terms and conditions of the AMD AOCL-BLIS
license agreement. You may obtain a copy of this license agreement from
https://www.amd.com/en/developer/aocl/dense/eula/blas-4-1-eula.html
https://www.amd.com/en/developer/aocl/dense/eula/blas-eula.html

dependencies.name: gmake
dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.

dependencies.name: lapack
dependencies.description: IBM's Engineering and Scientific Subroutine Library (ESSL).

dependencies.name: mpi
dependencies.description:
An open source Message Passing Interface implementation. The Open MPI
Project is an open source Message Passing Interface implementation that
is developed and maintained by a consortium of academic, research, and
industry partners. Open MPI is therefore able to combine the expertise,
technologies, and resources from all across the High Performance
Computing community in order to build the best MPI library available.
Open MPI offers advantages for system and software vendors, application
developers and computer science researchers.

dependencies.name: scalapack
dependencies.description:
ScaLAPACK is a library of high-performance linear algebra routines for
parallel distributed memory machines
